description:
In this talk, we will demo a simple machine learning accelerator
deployed on a commodity FPGA and developed using a Python-based
toolchain. The FPGA platform is based on an entry level Xilinx FPGA,
with a total cost of materials <$200. The toolchain uses a combination
of open source software, including PyTorch and
`ONNX <https://onnx.ai/>`__ for modeling, and
`Migen <https://github.com/m-labs/migen>`__ and
`LiteX <https://github.com/enjoy-digital/litex>`__ for the construction
of the System-on-chip. We will also survey the wide array of both open
source and proprietary vendor tools necessary to build this project, and
discuss the broader open source silicon landscape.
title: Building FPGA-based Machine Learning Accelerators in Python
